alert.note: Alert for Kanabec (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 13 at 1:53PM CDT until May 16 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... Snake River At Mora affecting Kanabec County. .While official observed river levels are not available due to bridge construction, upstream flows indicate the Snake River near Mora should be reaching flood stage early today. Minor flooding of the Snake River and nearby tributaries and creeks is expected to continue into the weekend. For the Snake River...including Mora...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Snake River At Mora. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Monday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data due to bridge construction. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.9 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.2 feet on 10/04/2017. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
